name: LaunchPI
tagline: Launch Raspberry PI Java applications from within Eclipse
body:
### Welcome to LaunchPI
LaunchPI is an Eclipse plug-in that makes it possible to run and debug Java projects on your Raspberry PI directly from withing Eclipse

### Installation
To install LaunchPI you need Eclipse [Kepler](http://www.eclipse.org/kepler/) or [Juno](http://www.eclipse.org/juno/). 
Then use this update site - https://raw.github.com/tsvetan-stoyanov/launchpi/v0.1/org.launchpi.us/target/site/site.xml

### Usage
* After the plug-in is installed switch to the _Remote System Explorer_ perspective and add a new _SSH Only_ connection to your Raspberry PI host.
![Adding connection to the Raspberry PI host](https://raw.github.com/tsvetan-stoyanov/launchpi/master/site/images/rse.png)

* Choose the main class that you want to execute and add a new _Raspberry PI Run Configuration_ for it ("_Run As..._" not available yet)
![Adding Raspberry PI Run Configuration](https://raw.github.com/tsvetan-stoyanov/launchpi/master/site/images/runc.png)
* Run it and enter your Raspberry PI user credentials when asked
* Use the same configuration for debug
* Enjoy

### Feedback And Support
In case you want to share your opinion, found a bug, request a feature or contribute to the project please use the GitHub issues system - https://github.com/tsvetan-stoyanov/launchpi/issues
